plugins.name: Archiver
plugins.description:
Archiver is a streamlined utility that helps you declutter your Figma workspace without losing valuable design history. With a single click, it automatically moves selected elements to a dedicated Archive page, organizing them chronologically by date.


Unlike manual archiving, this plugin:

  1. Preserves all properties including auto layout, components, and text styling
  2. Intelligently arranges archived items by date for easy retrieval
  3. Handles any element type (frames, components, vectors, text, etc.)
  4. Works with batch selections for efficient cleanup
  5. Maintains a clear naming convention with date stamps


Perfect for design teams that need to keep their working files clean while maintaining access to previous iterations, explorations, or unused concepts. Simply select what you want to archive, run the plugin, and continue designing with a cleaner workspace.
plugins.tagline: Organize Design History: One-Click Element Archiving

128151.name: Archiver
128151.description:

128151.release_notes:
Key fixes:

Added await figma.loadAllPagesAsync() at the beginning to ensure all pages are loaded
Added await archivePage.loadAsync() when finding the Archive page
Added null checks before accessing archivePage.children
Made the code more defensive with additional checks throughout
128151.tagline: Organize Design History: One-Click Element Archiving

plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
To use it, simply activate the plugin, import any component from any library, and it does the rest! 🚀


https://www.loom.com/share/6d526c11f63644318e9c604193e11e3d


Effortless Token Swapping Across Files

Swap Design Tokens between your design system and working files in seconds. Maintain consistency without duplicating libraries or styles.


Full-page Token Replacement

Need to update a full design with new tokens? One click with "Swap All" updates every node, text style, and color variable instantly — no manual work required.


Intelligent Scan & Replace

Automatically scan files for elements not linked to tokens — including colors and fonts — and batch replace them with variables from your design system. Eliminate inconsistencies with a few clicks.


Cross-theme & Project Flexibility

Manage multiple projects with a single design system source. Token Swapper ensures all visual assets remain connected to their proper tokens, even across brands or themes.


Non-destructive Workflow

Token Swapper doesn’t overwrite or break your original styles. Switch between token sets and preview changes without permanent commitment — perfect for testing themes or migrating designs.


Smart Query Processing

Let the plugin process bulk token changes in the background. Your edits persist even when closing the plugin, making large updates smoother and safer.


Beta Features: More Power, More Control

Our beta tools let you go even deeper — manage font tokens, swap icons, and process entire pages. Just stay in the same token session for best results while we keep improving.


FAQs

Does this work with free Figma plans?

Yes! Token Swapper is fully compatible with all Figma plans — free included. No need for professional tiers to keep your tokens in sync.


What if I use my own token naming system?

That’s okay! As long as your token names and structure match across files, Token Swapper will recognize and replace them intelligently.


Why use Token Swapper instead of doing it manually?

Manual token swaps are time-consuming, error-prone, and hard to scale. Token Swapper automates the entire process, saving you hours of work and ensuring consistency.


Tutorials

https://www.loom.com/share/3d743648bd3643e5a50b7dff7d54bbf2

https://www.loom.com/share/b3a6f11e12734fe18da5d30106fe4c54

https://www.loom.com/share/0ec7731eb20f404d9259222377f40cef
plugins.tagline: Swaps font, color and space tokens of components imported from other libraries.

plugins.name: Design Review Notes
plugins.description:
Streamline your design review process with an easy-to-use annotation tool for Figma. Select any object or frame, add comments, and assign a review status to keep your team aligned. Statuses are:

  1. Review Needed
  2. Approved
  3. Changes Needed
  4. Not Ready


If you have suggested for additional statuses or new features, let me know.


This tool is perfect for both async teams or capturing meeting notes during design critiques, this plugin helps designers flag areas for review and allows reviewers to provide structured feedback with full traceability. Capture design decisions, document revisions, and ensure clear communication, whether for quick approvals or in-depth discussions.


✦ Mark design elements for review

✦ Assign statuses for clarity

✦ Capture feedback & decisions in context

✦ Improve async collaboration & meeting documentation


Keep your design process transparent and efficient. Try it now!
plugins.tagline: Select objects in your file to quickly annotate and add a review status.

plugins.name: Selective Picker - Filter & Select Only What You Need in Figma!
plugins.description:
🎨 Selective Picker は、Figmaでより正確にオブジェクトを選択できる最強のプラグイン！

現在の選択範囲から テキスト・図形・画像 だけを簡単にフィルタリングして選択可能。

グループやフレームの内部要素 も自動で展開し、細かい調整がラクに！


✅ 主な機能:

•🔍 フィルタを適用して、テキスト・図形・画像のみを選択

•🎯 グループ & フレームの中の要素も自動選択

•🚀 選択作業を効率化し、デザインワークをスムーズに！


🔹 面倒な手動選択とはサヨナラ！ Selective Picker でスマートにオブジェクトを選ぼう！


----------------------------------------------------------

🎨 Selective Picker is the ultimate Figma plugin for precise selection! Easily filter and select only Text, Shapes, or Images from your current selection, even within Groups & Frames.


✅ Key Features:

•🔍 Filter & Select only Text, Objects, or Images

•🎯 Expands Groups & Frames to select inner elements

•🚀 Boost your workflow by focusing only on what matters


🔹 Say goodbye to manual selection and pick exactly what you need with Selective Picker!
plugins.tagline: Filter & Select Only What You Need in Figma.

plugins.name: Frame Duplicator
plugins.description:
Frame Duplicator is a plugin designed to help designers and social media managers quickly create multiple posts based on CSV data and images. Perfect for batch processing posts for social media, marketing, or any other repetitive content creation tasks.


In a sentence: Choose images and upload a CSV file listing the images and any text you’d like displayed. This plugin will read your CSV, duplicate a selected frame, and insert the specified images as the background along with the provided text in designated areas.


Key Features:

CSV Integration: Automatically populate frames with text fields such as titles and subtitles based on CSV data, making it easy to maintain consistent content across multiple designs.

Image Replacement: Efficiently replace images in frames based on file names specified in the CSV, allowing you to work seamlessly with visual content.

Aspect Ratio Preservation: Ensures that images maintain their aspect ratio when resized within frames, avoiding distortion or stretching.

Batch Frame Duplication: Create multiple frames with the click of a button, with each frame populated by unique data and images from your CSV.


How to Use:

Prepare CSV and Images: Make sure your CSV file includes columns for text fields (title and subtitle) and image filenames.


Your CSV column titles must be:

title, subtitle, imageName.


Select a Frame in Figma: Choose the frame you want to duplicate.


Your Frame must include text / rectangle elements titled:

##Title ##Image ##Subtitle


Upload CSV and Images: Load your CSV and corresponding image files through the plugin’s interface.

Create Frames: Click "Create Frames" to generate frames based on the CSV data, with each frame containing unique text and images row by row.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames with text and images based on CSV data for streamlined post creation

plugins.name: MultiDesign Assistant
plugins.description:
MultiDesign Assistant 是一款多功能設計輔助工具，能提升 Figma 的工作效率。這個插件提供了四個實用功能：


一鍵交換填充和描邊顏色：快速切換物件的填充和描邊顏色，節省設計時間。

快速調整尺寸：輸入具體數值，一鍵調整物件的長度和寬度。

等比縮小：通過輸入自定義比例或選擇預設值，輕鬆實現物件的等比例縮小。

圓形文字標籤：為選中的文字自動添加圓形背景，完美適用於創建數字標籤等設計元素。



MultiDesign Assistant is a versatile design tool aimed at enhancing productivity for Figma users. This plugin offers four practical features:


One-click Fill and Stroke Swap: Quickly exchange the fill and stroke colors of objects, saving design time.


Quick Size Adjustment: Input specific values to instantly adjust the length and width of objects.


Proportional Scaling: Easily scale objects proportionally by entering custom ratios or selecting from preset values.


Circular Text Labels: Automatically add circular backgrounds to selected text, perfect for creating number tags and similar design elements.
plugins.tagline: Swap colors, adjust sizes, scale proportionally, add circular text backgrounds.

plugins.name: Magic Style Guide
plugins.description:
✨ Magic Style Guide ✨

Create beautiful, clear, professional style guides — in just one click.


Magic Style Guide reads all your color variables (across multiple collections, including linked variables) and text styles to instantly generate an elegant, organized, and ready-to-share style guide.

Perfect for onboarding, documentation, and developer handoff — without any manual work.


---


🔮 Features:


- One-click magic: Instantly document all text styles and color variables.

- Smart descriptions: Auto-generate usage notes based on your style names.

- Linked variables support: Handles both direct and linked variables across collections.

- Multi-collection ready: Organizes styles beautifully even when they span several collections.

- Beautiful output: Clean, professional, and fully structured style guides.


---


Why you'll love it:

Save hours of boring documentation.

Keep your design systems clear, consistent, and ready for scale.

Focus on design — Magic Style Guide takes care of the rest. 🎩✨
plugins.tagline: Generate stunning style guides from Figma styles and variables — instantly!

130996.name: Magic Style Guide
130996.description:
✨ Magic Style Guide ✨

Create beautiful, clear, professional style guides — in just one click.


Magic Style Guide reads all your color variables (across multiple collections, including linked variables) and text styles to instantly generate an elegant, organized, and ready-to-share style guide.

Perfect for onboarding, documentation, and developer handoff — without any manual work.


---


🔮 Features:


- One-click magic: Instantly document all text styles and color variables.

- Smart descriptions: Auto-generate usage notes based on your style names.

- Linked variables support: Handles both direct and linked variables across collections.

- Multi-collection ready: Organizes styles beautifully even when they span several collections.

- Beautiful output: Clean, professional, and fully structured style guides.


---


Why you'll love it:

Save hours of boring documentation.

Keep your design systems clear, consistent, and ready for scale.

Focus on design — Magic Style Guide takes care of the rest. 🎩✨
130996.release_notes:
🖋️ Text Style Layout Glow-Up
I gave the text styles section a makeover. It’s now sharper, more elegant, and way easier to scan. Like a well-dressed typeface at a job interview.

🧠 Smart Descriptions for Humans
Now automatically adds short, helpful descriptions based on text sizes and color names. No more guessing what “Primary / Surface / Subtle” actually means.

🪄 New Plugin UI (because vibes matter)
The plugin window got a redesign — cleaner layout, a proper call-to-action, and even a lovely image… just for the aesthetic. Nothing essential, but everything nice.
130996.tagline: Generate stunning style guides from Figma styles and variables — instantly!

plugins.name: Chroma Forge
plugins.description:
Chroma Forge for Figma


A powerful color selection plugin for Figma that provides an intuitive color wheel and advanced color harmony tools to create consistent color palettes.


Features


Interactive Color Wheel

  1. High-precision color selection with a fully interactive color wheel
  2. Adjustable brightness and saturation sliders
  3. Real-time color preview
  4. HEX code input with validation


Color Harmony Tools

  1. Create cohesive color palettes using different harmony types:
  2. Analogous: Colors that are adjacent to each other on the color wheel
  3. Triad: Three colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  4. Complementary: Colors opposite each other on the color wheel
  5. Split Complementary: A main color and two colors adjacent to its complement
  6. Square: Four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  7. Compound: A combination of complementary and analogous harmonies
  8. Mono: A single color with various shades
  9. Custom: Create your own custom harmony by placing markers freely


Flexible Color Selection

  1. Select 2-6 colors at once (depending on harmony type)
  2. Drag markers on the wheel to fine-tune your color selection
  3. Automatic contrast adjustment for optimal visibility


Figma Integration

  1. Apply selected colors directly to selected elements
  2. Create color styles from your palette
  3. Generate color variables with automatic shade variants (10% to 100% brightness)
  4. Intelligent naming system for organizing colors


How to Use


Select a Harmony Type: Choose from the dropdown menu to define how colors relate to each other

Select Number of Colors: Choose how many colors you want in your palette (2-6)

Choose Your Base Color: Click and drag on the color wheel or enter a HEX code

Adjust Saturation and Brightness: Use the sliders to fine-tune your colors

Apply Colors: Use the buttons to:

  1. Apply directly to selected elements
  2. Add to Figma color styles
  3. Add to Figma variables (with automatic shade creation)


Email me

Behance

Dribbble

LinkedIn

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Create perfect palettes with color harmony tools

  9. Custom: Create your own custom harmony by placing markers freely


Flexible Color Selection

  1. Select 2-6 colors at once (depending on harmony type)
  2. Drag markers on the wheel to fine-tune your color selection
  3. Automatic contrast adjustment for optimal visibility


Figma Integration

  1. Apply selected colors directly to selected elements
  2. Create color styles from your palette
  3. Generate color variables with automatic shade variants (10% to 100% brightness)
  4. Intelligent naming system for organizing colors


How to Use


Select a Harmony Type: Choose from the dropdown menu to define how colors relate to each other

Select Number of Colors: Choose how many colors you want in your palette (2-6)

Choose Your Base Color: Click and drag on the color wheel or enter a HEX code

Adjust Saturation and Brightness: Use the sliders to fine-tune your colors

Apply Colors: Use the buttons to:

  1. Apply directly to selected elements
  2. Add to Figma color styles
  3. Add to Figma variables (with automatic shade creation)


Email me

Behance

Dribbble

LinkedIn

plugins.name: State Machines
plugins.description:
Create state machines and integrate them directly into your designs.


What is a state machine?


Think of a state machine as a way to organize all the different "states" your design can be in. For example, a form might have states like "empty," "filled," "submitting," or "error." State machines help you clearly define these states and the rules for moving between them, making complex interactions more manageable.


---


This plugin is experimental. Contributions and feature requests welcome: github.com/colebemis/figma-state-machines

accepted.name: Cole Bemis
accepted.description: Building things for people who build things. R&D at GitHub Next

plugins.tagline: Design complex interactions with state machines

plugins.name: Layer Formatter
plugins.description:
Streamline your design-to-development workflow with Layer Formatter, a powerful tool that simplifies layer renaming. Whether you need hyphens, underscores, camel case, or kebab case, this tool ensures your layers align perfectly with coding conventions.


Say goodbye to messy names and hello to clean, developer-friendly files. Perfect for effortless handoff and collaboration!


✨ Key Features ✨


  1. Auto-Space Conversion: Automatically replace spaces in layer names with underscores (_) or remove them entirely for clean, code-friendly naming.
  2. Batch Rename Layers: Rename multiple layers in seconds, saving time and improving efficiency.
  3. Flexible Naming Styles: Supports hyphens, underscores, camel case, kebab case, and more to fit your coding standards.
  4. Instant Updates: Apply changes with a single click—no need for tedious manual edits.
  5. Streamlined Handoff: Deliver developer-ready files with consistent, clean layer names for seamless collaboration.
plugins.tagline: Rename layers for seamless developer handoff

111512.description:

plugins.name: Sierotki Eliminator
plugins.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
plugins.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

105512.name: Sierotki Eliminator
105512.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
105512.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

plugins.name: Find and Replace Screens
plugins.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

114360.name: Find and Replace Screens
114360.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
114360.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

plugins.description:
Find the fonts you can't locate, hidden in unknown or messy files.


Have you ever opened a project only to find you have no idea what fonts were used? With our plugin, you can quickly and easily locate those hidden typefaces that complicate your work. Forget digging through messy files and wasting valuable time—uncover what once seemed impossible with just one click. Make your workflow faster and more efficient! ⚡


  1. 🔎 Have you been handed a file with no clues about its fonts?

plugins.name: HubSpot Developers: UI Extensions Auto Card Builder
plugins.description:
Welcome to the HubSpot Developers Figma Plugin for our UI Extensions Figma Design Kit

This plugin is brought to you by HubSpot DevRel Labs, an initiative to create solutions for developers to thrive while building with HubSpot.


Requirements: HubSpot UI Extensions Figma Design Kit


Create amazing HubSpot UI Extensions designs in minutes. Do you need to prototype a UI Extension quickly for your clients? Well, now you can with the HubSpot UI Extensions Figma plugin. Download the Figma Design Kit, install this plugin and choose from our library of UI components. Add multiple of the same components to a card, order them in any way you'd like, and watch the magic happen as the UI extension is built for you.


Upcoming Features

  1. Add pre-defined use-cases to choose from that will auto-populate the card with the appropriate components.
  2. Add a way to auto-generate the UI Extension code from the components you choose.


Please leave any and all feedback for this plugin on our Feedback form. Please specify that you're sharing feedback for our Figma UI Extension Builder plugin.

---------------

Made with 🧡 by the HubSpot DevRel Team.

Learn more about UI Extensions on our developer documentation site.

HubSpot UI Extensions are currently in beta and subject to the Early Adopter Program terms. Read the terms.
plugins.tagline: Create UI Extension cards with the click of a button.

plugins.name: Your AI Co-Pilot
plugins.description:
Your AI Co-Pilot provides instant design feedback directly within Figma. Select any design elements to receive AI-powered analysis across four key areas:


• UI Design: Visual hierarchy, color usage, spacing, and consistency

• Content: Readability, clarity, and copy suggestions

• User Experience: Usability issues and interaction patterns

• Accessibility: WCAG compliance recommendations


The plugin analyzes selected frames, components, or groups and generates actionable feedback to improve your designs. You can ask follow-up questions to get more detailed explanations or recommendations.


All analysis is performed securely through our backend API using advanced AI models. No design data is stored permanently - it's only processed temporarily during analysis.
plugins.tagline: Instant AI feedback on your designs

plugins.name: Frame to JSON - AI-powered Design-to-Code Converter
plugins.description:
🎯 What is it?

A powerful Figma plugin that transforms your design frames into structured JSON data, ensuring seamless developer handoff and design-to-code consistency.


✨ Key Features

•AI-powered frame analysis

•One-click frame-to-JSON conversion

•Complete hierarchy and style preservation

•Customizable export options

•Developer-friendly structured output


🚀 How to Use

1.Select your target frame(s) in Figma

2.Launch the Frame to JSON plugin

3.Review the extracted structure and properties

4.Click “Generate JSON”

5.Copy or download the JSON output instantly


🛠️ What You’ll Need

•Figma design frames


🔒 Security Note

Your data is processed securely, with no external storage. The plugin ensures precise design-to-code conversion while maintaining full control over your export preferences. No more manual adjustments—let AI handle the complexity! ✨
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma frames into clean JSON with one click your design-to-development bridge made simple!

plugins.name: CopyMate - Smarter, Faster, Better Copywriting
plugins.description:
Streamline your copywriting process without leaving Figma. CopyMate helps designers and writers enhance, translate, and refine UX copy in seconds while maintaining clarity, brand tone, and design consistency.


Enhance your copywriting ✍️

Improve writing quality with AI-powered suggestions that:

- Align with brand guidelines

- Improve clarity and readability

- Preserve original capitalization


Shorten Text Without Losing Meaning ✂️

Make text more concise while keeping intent and usability intact—perfect for button labels, tooltips, and UI elements.


Translate Text Instantly 🌍

Convert selected text into multiple languages while preserving formatting.


How CopyMate works

1. Select one or more text layers

2. Run CopyMate from the Figma plugin menu

3. Choose an action: Translate, Enhance, Shorten, or Quality Check

4. Review & Apply your changes instantly


Try CopyMate now and supercharge your copywriting workflow! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Smarter, Faster, Better Copywriting

plugins.name: DesignNamer
plugins.description:
Simplify and streamline your Figma projects with DesignNamer, the ultimate tool for renaming layers and frames with clear, descriptive names. Maintain consistency and order in your designs effortlessly.


Keep your Figma projects organized and professional with DesignNamer. Perfect for designers looking to enhance their workflow and maintain a clean, consistent design structure. Try it now and experience the difference!


High quality video is here https://youtu.be/uA470Amov40
plugins.tagline: Effortless Layer Renaming for Figma Designs

plugins.name: Variable Calculator
plugins.description:
Easily calculate variable values

Use Variable Calculator to apply math formulas, recalculating your variables. Apply to en entire collection, specific group, or specific mode. Great for scaling numbers for responsive behavior.


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Enter the formula to apply to the variables
  5. Calculate!


Tip

  1. Use a, b, c, n, v, x, $ or value to reference the current variable value.
  2. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  3. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  4. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Run math operations on your variable values!

plugins.name: Notion Book Cover Formatter
plugins.description:
Notion Book Cover Formatter solves the common problem of adapting vertical book covers (typically in 2:3 ratio) to Notion's responsive format. Instead of struggling with manual resizing and background creation, this plugin automatically:

  1. Positions your book cover perfectly within the Notion image dimensions
  2. Creates a beautiful and consistent background from the original cover


Step by step instructions:

  1. Upload a book cover image
  2. Plugin creates a frame containing the formatted image
  3. Export the frame
  4. Upload to Notion as "Files & Media"
plugins.tagline: Notion-ready book covers with a single image upload

131187.name: Notion Book Cover Formatter
131187.description:

  2. Creates a beautiful and consistent background from the original cover


Step by step instructions:

  1. Upload a book cover image
  2. Plugin creates a frame containing the formatted image
  3. Export the frame
  4. Upload to Notion as "Files & Media"

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to process image data from local file uploads using the fetch API to create formatted book covers.

131187.tagline: Notion-ready book covers with a single image upload

plugins.name: Big-Tech Style Design Challenges
plugins.description:
✨ Figma Plugin Description

Practice real-world design challenges directly inside Figma.

Sharpen your product thinking and UX skills with guided prompts and exercises — perfect for designers prepping for interviews or just looking to stay sharp.


🌐 What is Designus?

When you submit your solution via the plugin, your work gets published to the Designus platform — where you can explore other designers' answers and learn from diverse approaches.

Use the plugin to focus on solving the challenge, and head to the website to review and reflect on submitted solutions.


🛠 How to Use the Plugin

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Choose a challenge from the calendar
  3. Click Import to add the challenge & solution frame to your canvas
  4. Design your solution directly inside Figma
  5. Reopen the plugin and go to Export Solution
  6. Select your solution frame and write a short description
  7. Click Export to submit your answer
  8. Go to Designus website to review your submission and check out others' solutions.
plugins.tagline: Design Challenges - Level up your design skills through real design challenges.
